name: MOSAEIC Memory System
summary: A robust episodic-to-semantic memory scaffold consisting of FiveWindowCapture (Mental, Observation, Senses, Actions, Emotions) and TurningPoint to preserve high-emotion episodes and enable long-term knowledge stability.
core_logic: Encodes episodic-to-semantic transformation with temporal windowing (FiveWindowCapture) and TurningPoint for high-emotion preservation.

name: BeliefRewrite & MaladaptivePattern
summary: Mechanisms for memory reconsolidation and tracking recurring suboptimal patterns to facilitate better long-term behavioral alignment.
core_logic: Memory reconsolidation framework enabling belief updates and pattern tracking to improve long-term behavior alignment.

name: Pattern Evolution Tracker & Basin Reorganization
summary: Encodes how patterns evolve across projects; energy-based basin dynamics guide learning and generalization.
core_logic: Energy-based basin dynamics modeling evolution of patterns to foster robust generalization across tasks.

name: OODA Loop with Energy Budgeting
summary: Observe, Orient, Decide, Act cycles embedded as a cognitive rhythm with explicit energy budgeting, shaping timing and prioritization of actions.
rationale: By budgeting cognitive energy, OODA cycles become efficient, timely, and aligned with resource constraints.

name: Graphiti/Neo4j as Single Source of Truth with Temporal Validity and Provenance
summary: Graphiti/Neo4j serves as the single source of truth with temporal validity (valid_at/invalid_at) and provenance metadata to support auditable decision traces.
rationale: Provides auditable, time-bound data lineage enabling reproducible and trustworthy decision-making.

name: MCP Bridge Pattern for Tool Decoupling
summary: Decouples cognition from tools, enabling safe, testable, and resilient tool usage via ToolCollection.from_mcp.
rationale: Promotes safe tool integration and repeatable experimentation by isolating cognitive reasoning from tool interfaces.

name: Avatar Knowledge Graph Schema
summary: Schema comprising PainPoint, Objection, Desire, Belief, Behavior, VoicePattern, and FailedSolution enabling granular, personalized client engagement and provenance persistence.
core_logic: Structured graph schema for avatar modeling with persistent provenance across client interactions.

name: Specialized Smolagents & AvatarResearcher Orchestrator
summary: Specialized smolagents (PainAnalyst, ObjectionHandler, VoiceExtractor) plus an AvatarResearcher orchestrator enable scalable, modular avatar research workflows.
core_logic: Modular agent roles and orchestration to scale avatar research pipelines.

name: Ground-Truth Ingestion (IAS-copy-brief.md)
summary: Ground-truth ingestion drives a reliable starting point for avatar modeling; bulk ingestion and Graphiti integration ensure provenance preservation.
core_logic: Ingest IAS-copy-brief.md as avatar ground truth; bulk ingestion and Graphiti integration ensure provenance preservation.

name: Rapid Observe-Orient-Decide-Act Cycles
summary: The log demonstrates quick scanning, contextual orientation (distinguishing real files from AppleDouble metadata), decisive action, and immediate feedback.
rationale: Fast OODA cycles enable rapid situational awareness and timely responses.

name: Pragmatic Data Hygiene
summary: Prioritize cleanup of unnecessary assets (e.g., .srt files) while acknowledging metadata artifacts; distinguish operational data from metadata.
rationale: Maintains data quality and reduces noise by routine data hygiene practices.

name: Preserve Provenance & Auditability
summary: Record session identifiers, timestamps, actions, and outcomes to support traceability and accountability.
rationale: Ensures reproducibility and accountability through traceable data lineage.

name: Idempotent & Auditable Actions
summary: Actions can be repeated without adverse effects; provide clear success/failure reporting to enable repeatability.
rationale: Supports safe experimentation and reliable re-execution.

name: Ground Truth Ingestion (Canonical Reference)
summary: Ingest IAS-copy-brief.md as the avatar ground truth; establishes a canonical reference for avatar research; enables Graphiti/Neo4j ingestion and downstream knowledge modeling.
core_logic: Ingest IAS-copy-brief.md as canonical reference; sources: 010-heartbeat-handoff, 019-avatar-knowledge-graph; enables Graphiti/Neo4j ingestion and downstream knowledge modeling.

name: Episodic-to-Semantic Memory
summary: Explicit episodic-to-semantic memory consolidation with time-based decay, turning points, and automatic consolidation triggers to stabilize long-term knowledge.
core_logic: Explicit episodic-to-semantic memory consolidation with time-based decay, turning points, and automatic consolidation triggers to stabilize long-term knowledge.

name: Trajectory-aware Context
summary: ContextBuilder provides trajectories; decision adapter includes trajectories in the agent context; enables trajectory-aware reasoning in OODA loop.
core_logic: Expose trajectory data to the decision context to enable trajectory-aware reasoning within the OODA loop.

name: MCP Bridge Resilience
summary: Tool loading via ToolCollection.from_mcp decouples agents from the existence of individual tools, increasing robustness to tool deletions.
core_logic: Decouple tool availability from agents by loading tools through a collection interface, reducing fragility to tool deletion.

name: Avatar Knowledge Graph Schema
summary: Graph schema design (PainPoint, Objection, Desire, Belief, Behavior, VoicePattern, etc.) and Graphiti/Neo4j integration to support rich avatar modeling.
core_logic: Define a graph schema for avatars and enable Graphiti/Neo4j integration to model rich agent personas.

name: Explicit termination signals as boundary markers in constrained environments
summary: Explicit termination signals function as boundary markers in constrained interactive environments.

name: Graceful termination and provenance preservation for non-actionable content
summary: When content is non-actionable, the prudent pattern is to gracefully terminate and preserve provenance.

name: Provenance-first traceability
summary: Preserving provenance metadata (session ID, timestamps) is essential for traceable wisdom extraction.

name: Read-to-understand-first
summary: Read-to-understand-first: establish context by reading files/codebase before taking action

name: Environment awareness
summary: Environment awareness: respect system states and constraints (TodoWrite disabled, OpenSpec presence)

name: Modular exploration
summary: Modular exploration: decompose into documentation (CLAUDE.md), architecture (Archon MCP), interfaces (OpenSpec)

name: Documentation as navigation anchor
summary: Documentation as navigation anchor: use Core CLAUDE.md as foundational reference

name: Provenance-first reference
summary: Provenance-first: preserve traceability and source metadata from the outset

name: Iterative discovery
summary: Iterative discovery: incremental reading, summarizing, and validating before proceeding

name: Observe phase
summary: Observe: read relevant files; understand codebase structure

name: Orient phase
summary: Orient: note system state (OpenSpec status); recognize access controls (TodoWrite disabled)

name: Decide phase
summary: Decide: determine next exploration focus (OpenSpec, codebase)

name: Act-Phase Targeted Exploration
summary: In the Act phase, begin targeted exploration of the environment (e.g., survey first pages, docs) to surface actionable signals while anchoring exploration to provenance and planning context.
rationale: Targets efficient information-gathering and reduces risk by anchoring exploration to concrete interfaces and documentation.

name: Renormalised Generative Models (RGM) for Hierarchical Planning
summary: RGM enables scale-free, hierarchical planning by coarse-graining state representations across levels, maintaining tractable inference while expanding planning horizons.
rationale: Coarse-graining preserves essential structure while enabling multi-level planning across wide state spaces.

name: Active Inference Loop: Perceive–Plan–Act
summary: Active Inference provides a principled loop: perceive (update beliefs from observations), plan (evaluate actions via expected free energy), and act (update policies), closing the perception-action cycle.
core_logic: Belief updating drives both action and future predictions; action policies are optimized to minimize expected free energy.

name: Hierarchical Generative Core (A,B,C,D,E)
summary: Core tensors A, B, C, D, E encode likelihoods, transitions, path dynamics, and priors, forming a structured generative model across hierarchy.
core_logic: Tensor components map observations to latent states, encode transition dynamics, and constrain priors across hierarchy.

name: Memory-Integrated Autobiographical Agents
summary: Memory integration (episodic, semantic, procedural, strategic) is essential for autobiographical agents and informs planning through learned priors.
core_logic: Memory systems provide priors and experiential data that shape predictions and decisions.

name: Embodied Enactive Design and Autopoiesis
summary: Embodied enactive design (self/non-self boundary, autopoiesis) supports attachment to diverse interfaces and robust adaptation.
core_logic: Agency arises from ongoing self-organization balanced with external coupling.

name: Mature Workflow Practices as System Architecture
summary: Mature workflow practices (TDD, feature branches, Serena search, Archon, Neo4j schemas, CI) are treated as first-class components of system architecture.
rationale: Engineering practices must be embedded in architecture to ensure reliability, traceability, and maintainability.

name: Visualization and Narration for Interpretability
summary: Visualization and narration (cartpole_live, cartpole_narrated) provide interpretable traces of internal thinking, aiding validation and trust.
core_logic: External traces map internal decisions to observable narratives for auditing.

name: Explicit Provenance and Logging
summary: Provenance is preserved through explicit session IDs, milestone logs, commits, test coverage, and documented architecture decisions.
rationale: Preserving provenance enables reproducibility, auditing, and trust.

name: System-First Mental Model
summary: Mental Model: System-first orientation, observe-before-action, iterative learning, and provenance-centric analytics.
core_logic: Prioritize holistic system understanding before optimizing parts.

name: Observe–Orient–Decide–Act (OODA) in Codebase
summary: Observe → Orient → Decide → Act: the log demonstrates an OODA-like cycle with observing the codebase and system state, orienting to tasks, deciding on the next actions, and acting by exploring pages and directories.
core_logic: Cycle-based reasoning aligns observation with task-driven action.

name: Exploration Discipline: Understand Before Acting
summary: Exploration discipline: Start with understanding the environment (codebase, status of Archon) before taking concrete actions.
rationale: A foundational discipline to prevent rash changes and improve alignment with goals.

name: Provenance Emphasis in Exploration
summary: Provenance emphasis: Metadata and session provenance are treated as core elements to preserve during exploration.
rationale: Preserves context and decisions across exploration sessions.

name: Plan-Based Phased Deployment
summary: Plan-based phased deployment (Phases A/B) with staged milestones.
rationale: Phased deployment reduces risk and enables incremental validation.

name: Spec-Driven Governance (SpecKit)
summary: Spec-driven governance (SpecKit, 001-006 specs, checklists, /speckit workflows)
rationale: Explicit specifications and workflows govern behavior and quality.

name: MultiEnvironmentDeploymentWithSecureNetworking
summary: Multi-environment deployment pattern (local dev vs VPS deployment) with explicit networking (docker networks) and secure access controls
rationale: Ensures consistent deployment across environments and enforces network isolation and secure access policies.

name: IncrementalKnowledgeGraphConstruction
summary: Incremental knowledge graph construction (Graphiti ingestion, entity/relationship extraction, provenance)
rationale: Builds a living semantic model with traceable provenance for every inference.

name: MemoryArchitectureAndSelfStructureAwareness
summary: Memory architecture framing (5-layer memory + autobiographical layer) and self-structure awareness

name: OODAInspiredDecisionCycle
summary: OODA-like decision cycles evidenced by Observe (state discovery), Orient (plan/architecture), Decide (deployment/testing), Act (ingest/test/commit)
rationale: Implements a rapid, looped feedback mechanism for deployment and data ingestion with disciplined branching.

name: ProvenanceCentricWorkflow
summary: Provenance-centric workflow (plan docs, commits, Archon/Plan mode, memory of decisions)
rationale: Anchors decisions in traceable plans and commit histories to improve auditability.

name: BatchProcessingToManageComplexity
summary: Batch processing approach (Batch 1 complete, Batch 2 pending) to manage complexity
rationale: Segments work to reduce cognitive load and validate increments before proceeding.

name: RiskMitigationAndAccessControlPatterns
summary: Risk/mitigation patterns (revoking SSH access, environment variable handling, health checks)
rationale: Defines concrete controls to reduce security and reliability risks during operations.

name: ConstraintAwareProblemSolving
summary: Operate within explicit capabilities and read-only limits; plan tasks accordingly.

name: ReadOnlyExploration
summary: Search and analyze codebase with non-destructive methods (Glob, Grep, Read tools).

name: ExplicitCapabilityDeclaration
summary: Clearly state what I can do and what I cannot do to avoid scope creep.

name: ModularAnalysis
summary: Break problem into code search, file navigation, and pattern reporting.

name: ProvenanceFirstReporting
summary: Preserve origin metadata for all findings to support traceability.

name: MetaLearningFromLogs
summary: Infer patterns and opportunities for improvement from transcript data.

name: DependencyAwareWorkflow
summary: Design processes with explicit checks for essential services (e.g., Archon MCP) and define fallback paths when dependencies are unavailable.

name: ProvenanceFirstDesign
summary: Preserve and attach provenance metadata to outputs to enable traceability across the wisdom extraction workflow.

name: Fault-tolerant orchestration
summary: Recognize that optional components or non-critical services can be skipped or rerouted when unavailable, enabling graceful degradation.
core_logic: Graceful degradation achieved by skipping or rerouting non-critical components when unavailable.

name: Observability-driven decision making
summary: Use observable states (server connectivity, task discovery status) to orient and decide on next actions.
core_logic: Decisions are guided by real-time observable system states.

name: Modular task discovery
summary: Separate discovery (what tasks exist) from execution (performing tasks) to enable flexible adaptation when blockers occur.
core_logic: Decouple discovery from execution to adapt to blockers without stalling progress.

name: Decompose-and-Phase
summary: Break complex initiatives into well-defined phases (ingestion, metadata, deduplication, CLI, search, maintenance) to constrain scope and enable staged value delivery.
rationale: Constrains scope and enables staged value delivery by dividing work into phases.

name: Provenance-First
summary: Capture and preserve metadata about decisions, actions, and sources at every step to enable auditability and reproducibility.
rationale: Ensures traceability and reproducibility of outcomes.

name: Prioritized Execution
summary: Sort tasks by descending priority (100 to 60) to tackle high-impact work first.
rationale: Focuses on high-value work and reduces resistance from lower-priority tasks.

name: Automation-Driven Creation
summary: Automate project creation and artifact generation from source docs to reduce drift.
rationale: Minimizes drift between source documents and produced artifacts.

name: Iterative Refinement
summary: Use short feedback loops to validate alignment and adapt plans accordingly.
rationale: Enables course correction through rapid feedback.

name: Observe stage
summary: Scan the log and docs to understand landscape

name: Orient stage
summary: Infer project goals, architecture, and constraints from logs

name: Decide stage
summary: Determine priority ordering and default assignments

name: Act stage
summary: Execute project creation, task instantiation, and provenance logging

name: Feedback stage
summary: Review outcomes (task counts, IDs) and refine next steps

name: Readiness and Compliance Posture
summary: Readiness and compliance posture (evidenced by 'Core CLAUDE.md read')

name: System-State Awareness
summary: System-state awareness (evidenced by 'Archon MCP active (TodoWrite disabled)')

name: Warmup-driven Interaction Pattern
summary: A deliberate pre-action phase that seeks tasks before acting to reduce misalignment and wasted effort. It involves prompting for objectives, confirming scope, and aligning expectations before proceeding.
rationale: Reduces scope drift and improves task relevance by frontloading task discovery.

name: Explicit Task Scoping
summary: Before acting, ask clarifying questions to define goals, success criteria, and boundaries; enumerate the tasks required to complete the objective.
rationale: Prevents ambiguity and guides subsequent decisions and actions.

name: Observe: System State and Active Tasks
summary: Perform a structured observation: check current system state (resources, context) and assess active tasks to establish a baseline before choosing next steps.
core_logic: Monitor environment, detect tasks, update situational awareness, and feed into subsequent Orientation.

name: Orient: Interpret Constraints and Warmup Context
summary: Interpret external constraints (e.g., CLAUDE.md, MCP) and recognize warmup context to frame actions within permitted boundaries.
core_logic: Map constraints and contextual cues to capability space; maintain policy alignment.

name: Decide: Seek User Instruction Before Action
summary: Prefer requesting explicit user instructions over autonomous action; defer decision-making until guidance is obtained.
rationale: Maintains alignment with user goals and reduces risk of unintended actions.

name: Act: Await User Instruction; No Action Prematurely
summary: Do not execute actions until explicit instruction is provided; conserve cognitive and operational resources until confirmed tasks exist.
rationale: Prevents unintended consequences and drift from user intent.

name: Provenance-aware Logging
summary: Preserve provenance for traceability by capturing source logs, session IDs, timestamps, and notes; feed into knowledge-graph ingestion for traceable lineage.
core_logic: Systematically structure provenance metadata for future retrieval.

name: Session Continuity via Attractor Memory
summary: Startup context is reconstructed by an attractor-based memory pipeline and injected at session start to maintain continuity across sessions.
core_logic: Use attractor-based memory to retrieve and inject startup context.

name: Prefetched Tasks Pattern
summary: Prefetch local Archon tasks and send to VPS to bridge network isolation while preserving latency bounds, ensuring readiness to act when permitted.
core_logic: Pre-fetch and forward tasks to maintain responsiveness under isolation.

name: Episodic Memory Retrieval via Graphiti
summary: When Archon data is insufficient, prefer graph-backed episodic memories to support reasoning and decision making.
core_logic: Query graph-backed memories to fill gaps.

name: Progressive Disclosure
summary: Inject only compact, provenance-rich context; store raw memories for future expansion to balance immediacy with long-term knowledge growth.
rationale: Ensures usable context now while preserving richer data for future expansion.

name: Provenance Preservation
summary: Maintain source metadata (project, task IDs, fragment types, and lineage) to support traceability and provenance across fragments.
core_logic: Design and enforce a provenance metadata schema.

name: Constraint-driven Analysis
summary: Operate within read-only constraints and plan steps before acting to minimize risky or unauthorized actions.
rationale: Policy-compliant pre-planning reduces risk.

name: Scope-first Inquiry
summary: Ask clarifying questions about what to search and analyze to define scope early and avoid drift.
rationale: Clarifies objectives and boundaries.

name: Observability and Meta-data Awareness
summary: Capture session IDs, timestamps, platform; maintain provenance for visibility and auditability across interactions.
core_logic: Instrumentation and logging hooks to gather and preserve session metadata.

name: Search-First Information Gathering
summary: Leverage retrieval to build understanding before coding.

name: Non-destructive Exploration
summary: Prefer exploration of logs and data rather than altering files.

name: Provenance-First Governance
summary: Preserve provenance metadata and reproducibility.

name: Ontological Framing and Credibility
summary: Mental models: Problems are framed in ontological terms (empty/hollow) rather than mere situational pain; credibility relies on data, peer validation, and transparent trade-offs; avoid 'inner work' framing; present authenticity as strategic, not therapeutic.

name: OODA-Oriented Communication
summary: OODA-oriented communication: Observe credibility signals (data, credentials, peer reps); Orient by mapping values to measurable outcomes (performance, risk management, isolation); Decide to present precise, evidence-based claims with explicit trade-offs; Act with actionable, high-signal content and references.

name: Sensitive Topics - Skill-Building Framing
summary: Frame emotional work as skill-building (not therapy), acknowledge shame without judgment, use mechanical/somatic metaphors, and maintain a focus on performance and mastery rather than healing.

name: Intellectual Expectations and Precision
summary: Respect complexity, use precise language, cite research, acknowledge trade-offs, tailor messaging to their field (surgeon, founder, tech exec).

name: Seen vs Sold: Authentic Competence
summary: What makes them feel seen vs sold: See their isolation and paradoxes, validate real pain despite success, avoid patronizing or overpromising language; emphasize competence, ROI, and authentic expertise.

name: Big-Picture Architecture First
summary: Prioritize understanding the overall system structure and cross-file relationships before delving into code or implementation details.
core_logic: Global view before detail.

name: DRY / Avoid Redundancy
summary: Minimize repetition; avoid duplicating analysis; compile insights with provenance.
core_logic: Do not repeat yourself; consolidate with provenance.

name: Layered Architecture & Separation of Concerns
summary: Treat infra DI framework, BlockSuite integration, frontend/backend/native modules as distinct layers with defined interaction surfaces.
core_logic: Layered design with clear interfaces.

name: Provenance-Aware Reasoning
summary: Record and attach provenance to each insight (session IDs, source URLs, files) for traceability.
core_logic: Attach provenance to all reasoning.

name: Incremental / Guided Delivery
summary: Provide high-level guidance first, then more detail; avoid overwhelming with low-value content.
core_logic: Progress from high-level to detail to prevent overload.

name: OODA Loop in Workflow
summary: Observe repository state, Orient by synthesizing findings, Decide on deliverable, Act by producing the artifact; iterate.
core_logic: Cycle Observe-Orient-Decide-Act within workflows.

name: CTC Core Philosophy
summary: Coaching The Conversion: transformation must occur within the prospect before, during, and through the sales process; the conversion coach guides belief shifts across the entire funnel.
rationale: Principles: Transformation-before-sale; Coaching conversion through copy; Build prospect responsiveness; Applications: Frame messaging, structure copy hierarchy, increase engagement.

name: SPIAD Framework
summary: Sales Page In A Day: a 15-section template organized to coach transformation across a single asset.
core_logic: A modular, 15-section sequence guiding transformation of a single asset from gap discovery to exit gap.

name: 3D Avatar: Prospect Dimensions
summary: Dynamic, living understanding of the prospect across three dimensions: Demographics, Everyday Psychographics, and Charged-Up Ethos Graphics.
core_logic: An evolving, multi-dimensional representation of the prospect used for personalization and targeting.

name: MoHT & MoHP (Moment of Highest Tension / Moment of Highest Pleasure)
summary: MoHT captures a hyper-specific, filmable problem moment; MoHP captures the redemption point after the problem is solved.
core_logic: Center messaging on concrete tensions and redemption to drive action.

name: Sacred Cows
summary: Identify and slaughter limiting beliefs and paradigms that hinder progress; replace with empowering beliefs.
core_logic: Diagnose false beliefs and reframe objections as opportunities via new beliefs.

name: The Starbucks Test (100 Words per Minute Rule)
summary: Copy length should align with the time needed to coach the conversion; longer assets for longer decisions, shorter for quick decisions.
core_logic: Match length to decision complexity and pacing to optimize engagement and comprehension.

name: Enrollment Extractor & Launch Bible
summary: Mining high-conversion calls to extract messaging; the Launch Bible compiles all insights for funnel creation.
core_logic: Preserve client voice and aha moments; sign off on insights before heavy writing.

name: Divergent Roads & Market's Search for Meaning
summary: Present parallel realities (with/without product) at multiple time checkpoints; reframe past failures as prerequisites for progress.
core_logic: Frame decision points by showing two viable realities to illuminate risk and opportunity.

name: Migration-driven OpenSpec Consolidation: WHAT vs HOW
summary: Migration-driven consolidation: unify legacy specs into a single OpenSpec capability with distinct WHAT vs HOW.
rationale: Consolidates legacy specs into a unified capability with clear WHAT vs HOW distinctions.

name: Governance-first Architecture: Graph Channel Enforcement
summary: Governance-first architecture: enforce Graph Channel usage and CI checks to block direct driver access.
rationale: Enforce governance to ensure auditable, secure access.

name: Staged Validation Mindset: Tiered Migration Checks
summary: Staged validation mindset: guide migration with Tiered checks (count, content, functional).
rationale: Mitigate risk by validating across dimensions before progression.

name: Provenance-centric Engineering: Lineage through Session Metadata
summary: Provenance-centric engineering: preserve session metadata and source logs for lineage tracking.
rationale: Maintain traceability of insights and decisions.

name: Hybrid Search Philosophy: Vector, Full-Text, and Graph Discovery
summary: Hybrid search philosophy: blend vector indexing, full-text, and graph traversal for robust discovery.

name: Provenance-aware Design: Auditable Metadata for Wisdom Extraction
summary: Provenance-aware design: maintain explicit metadata for auditable wisdom extraction.

name: Performance-first Constraints: Latency Targets Early
summary: Performance-first constraints: embed latency targets early to steer architecture decisions.

name: Entity-centric Evolution: Migrate Core Ontology for Graph Integrity
summary: Entity-centric evolution: migrate core ontology (Architecture, Episode, Attractor Basin, etc.) to preserve graph integrity.

name: Safe, Read-Only Exploration
summary: Operate in a safe, non-destructive mode (read-only) to minimize risk while exploring.
core_logic: Inspect and reason without mutating state; rely on observation and non-destructive queries to gather information.

name: Scoped Discovery Before Deep Dive
summary: Start with scoped discovery (search for files, patterns) before deep-diving into code or conversations.
core_logic: Limit initial scope to high-signal areas; gather context before committing cognitive effort to deep analysis.

name: Provenance & Reproducibility Emphasis
summary: Prioritize provenance and auditability; capture sources, decisions, and context for reproducibility.
core_logic: Record sources, decisions, and context so analyses can be traced and reproduced.

name: Pattern Extraction Across Interactions
summary: Extract recurring themes across interactions to build transferable patterns (patterns over single data points).
core_logic: Cluster observations to reveal stable patterns rather than overfitting to isolated data points.

name: Clarification-Driven Scope Bounding
summary: Use clarifying questions to bound scope and reduce cognitive load; iterative refinement is preferred.
core_logic: Ask targeted questions to tighten requirements and progressively refine the task.

name: OODA Loop in Practice
summary: OODA loop as a fundamental pattern: Observe status, Orient to architecture and dependencies, Decide on the next phase, and Act through concrete commands and commits, iterating rapidly.
core_logic: Cycle through Observe-Orient-Decide-Act to make fast, informed decisions and take concrete actions.

name: Phase-based Orchestration with Gates
summary: Work is organized into clearly defined phases (Import, Sync, Archive, Documentation) with explicit gates and milestones, enabling risk-managed progression.
rationale: Defines stopping points to manage risk and ensure readiness before moving to the next phase.

name: Bidirectional Synchronization
summary: Maintain a two-way linkage between OpenSpec and Archon via .archon-project-id to preserve provenance and ensure consistent state across systems.
rationale: Two-way linkage ensures updates propagate and provenance remains intact across systems.

name: Provenance & Auditability
summary: Preserve provenance metadata (session IDs, commit IDs, timestamps, task IDs) to support traceability and reproducibility.
rationale: Metadata-driven traceability enables auditability and reproducibility of outcomes.

name: Authoritative State Priority in Conflicts
summary: When conflict arises between sources, give priority to the authoritative state (Archon) for updates; manual overrides can prevent regression.
core_logic: Favor canonical or authoritative source to resolve conflicts and avoid regressions.

name: Automation-First Ethos
summary: Rely on automation (slash commands, scripts) to minimize manual toil and reduce human error in repetitive coordination tasks.
core_logic: Automate repetitive workflows to reduce errors and speed up coordination.

name: Validation-Driven Archiving
summary: Archive is conditioned on complete validation; provide actionable remediation guidance and explicit error messages for incomplete states.
rationale: Ensure archives reflect validated states and guide remediation when validation fails.

name: Documentation as Living Artifact
summary: Docs (AGENTS.md, CLAUDE.md) evolve with the system, embedding current capabilities and usage patterns to keep mental models aligned.
rationale: Living documentation aligns users with current capabilities and practices.

name: Startup Readiness Gate
summary: Startup protocol as a readiness gate: perform core checks before diving into tasks (e.g., 'Core CLAUDE.md read', 'Archon MCP active').
core_logic: Require essential prerequisites to be verified before task engagement.

name: Early Task Discovery
summary: Task discovery early: performing OpenSpec checks and task discovery to constrain scope and align expectations.
core_logic: Identify high-signal tasks early to bound scope and set expectations.

name: OODA Pattern for System Startup
summary: Observe-Orient-Decide-Act (OODA) pattern visible in sequence: Observe system state (docs read, components), Orient to capabilities (OpenSpec, MCP), Decide on next steps (task discovery), Act (initiate startup steps).

name: Provenance-Preserving Output
summary: Explicit provenance consideration: metadata like session IDs, timestamps, and source references should be preserved in outputs.
rationale: Preserve traceability and auditability of outputs.

name: Modularity and Pluggability
summary: Modularity and pluggability: reliance on OpenSpec suggests a mental model favoring modular specs for scalable capability.

name: Warmup as Risk Reduction
summary: Warmup checks serve as preflight to validate readiness and reduce downstream errors.

name: Environment-First Mental Model
summary: Prioritize understanding the information ecology (inputs, context, constraints) before acting; reduces misinterpretation and guides targeted analysis.

name: Provenance-Preserving Practice
summary: Capture source metadata and lineage for every insight to enable traceability and auditability.
rationale: Anchors insights to their origins to support accountability.

name: Iterative Refinement
summary: Initiate with coarse summaries and progressively refine as more content becomes available or clarified.

name: OODA-Driven Operation
summary: Favor rapid Observe-Orient-Decide-Act cycles with explicit feedback loops to stabilize understanding in sparse-content scenarios.

name: Sparseness-Resilient Reasoning
summary: When data is sparse, declare assumptions clearly and avoid over-claiming; build insights from minimal viable signals.

name: Fidelity-First Funnel Replication
summary: In high-conversion workflows, replicating a proven template (Todd's OTO page) with exact typography, colors, and structure tends to preserve performance and avoid regressions caused by superficial changes.
rationale: Preserves performance by avoiding uncontrolled changes.

name: OODA Loop: Observation → Decide → Act
summary: Constantly observe asset integrity (hero image presence, font sizing, color palette) and promptly decide to revert to or copy proven assets when deviations threaten conversions; act by updating HTML/CSS to align with the reference.

name: Provenance-anchored Adaptation
summary: All changes and decisions are anchored to the origin: the original Unbounce/Todd pages and the supplied content. This ensures traceability and defensibility of design choices.
rationale: Anchored to origin for traceability and defensibility.

name: Mosaic-Mapping Readiness
summary: Capturing Senses, Actions, Emotions, Impulses, Cognitions (S.A.E.I.C.) reveals tensions between aesthetic fidelity and functional constraints (e.g., missing hero image, asset URLs).

name: Voice Consistency Principle
summary: Maintaining the established page voice (conversational, direct, conversion-focused) is critical to sustaining audience trust and conversions across sections.
rationale: Consistent voice sustains trust and conversions.

name: MOSAEIC Memory System
summary: The MOSAEIC memory system serves as a robust scaffold that transitions experiences from episodic to semantic memory. Utilizing frameworks like FiveWindowCapture and TurningPoint, it emphasizes the preservation of high-emotion experiences to enhance memory retention and retrieval.

name: Memory Reconsolidation Framework
summary: Employing concepts like BeliefRewrite and MaladaptivePattern, this framework facilitates memory reconsolidation and helps in identifying and tracking recurring suboptimal behaviors. This systematic approach encourages alignment with better long-term behavior patterns.

name: Pattern Tracking and Evolution
summary: Tools like PatternEvolutionTracker and BasinReorganizationService record the evolution of cognitive patterns across projects. By applying energy-based basin dynamics, it supports effective learning and generalization through different contexts.

name: OODA Loop Integration
summary: The OODA loop, which stands for Observe, Orient, Decide, Act, is ingrained as a cognitive rhythm that aligns with explicit energy budgeting. This integration influences not just the timing but also the prioritization of actions taken in various scenarios.

name: Graphiti as Decision Audit Tool
summary: Utilizing Graphiti/Neo4j as a single source of truth enhances data integrity with features like temporal validity and provenance metadata. This supports the creation of auditable decision traces, fostering accountability in decision-making processes.

name: MCP Bridge Pattern
summary: The MCP Bridge Pattern effectively decouples cognition from the tools utilized, allowing for safer and more resilient experimentation with tool usage. This creates a systematic approach toward testable engagement via ToolCollection.from_mcp.

name: Avatar Knowledge Graph Schema
summary: The Avatar Knowledge Graph schema includes elements such as PainPoint, Objection, and Desire to personalize client engagement effectively. It also emphasizes the importance of preserving provenance within client interactions to support ongoing understanding.

name: Specialized Agents for Avatar Research
summary: Specialized agents like PainAnalyst, ObjectionHandler, and VoiceExtractor, along with an orchestrator like AvatarResearcher, create scalable, modular workflows for avatar research. This enhances the efficiency of research processes and adaptability to client needs.

name: Ground Truth Ingestion
summary: Ground-truth ingestion processes, such as using IAS-copy-brief.md, ensure a reliable foundation for avatar modeling. Bulk ingestion and integration with Graphiti allow for thorough provenance preservation, reinforcing the reliability of data used.

name: Rapid OODA Cycles
summary: Rapid observe-orient-decide-act cycles promote swift decision-making through quick contextual scans and decisive actions based on immediate feedback. This principle enhances responsiveness to changing conditions, enabling optimized performance.

name: Pragmatic Data Hygiene
summary: Prioritize the cleanup of unnecessary assets while distinguishing operational data from metadata. This ensures a lean data environment conducive to revealing actionable insights and reducing noise.

name: Preserve Provenance and Auditability
summary: Maintain meticulous records of session identifiers, timestamps, actions, and outcomes to support traceability and accountability in data interactions. This practice is critical in fostering trust and transparency.

name: Idempotent and Auditable Actions
summary: Design actions that can be repeated without adverse effects while providing clear success/failure reporting. This commitment to repeatability enhances reliability in complex systems.

name: Ground Truth Ingestion
summary: Ingesting IAS-copy-brief.md serves as the avatar's ground truth, establishing a canonical reference for avatar research. This process enables effective Graphiti/Neo4j ingestion and enhances downstream knowledge modeling.

name: Episodic-to-Semantic Memory
summary: This model supports explicit consolidation of episodic memories into semantic knowledge with time-based decay and automatic triggers for stabilization. It is essential for enhancing long-term cognitive structures.

name: Trajectory-aware Context
summary: ContextBuilder provides trajectories to enhance decision-making processes. The inclusion of trajectory data in agent contexts facilitates reasoning in the OODA loop, improving responsiveness in complex scenarios.

name: MCP Bridge Resilience
summary: Using ToolCollection.from_mcp to load tools decouples agents from individual tool relevance, enhancing system robustness against tool deletions and failures. This improves operational continuity.

name: Avatar Knowledge Graph Schema
summary: This schema design integrates rich attributes such as PainPoint and VoicePattern to enhance avatar modeling, thereby improving the understanding of user interactions and preferences.

name: Explicit Termination Signals
summary: Employ explicit termination signals as boundary markers in interactive environments to manage engagement effectively. This helps in delineating the scope of operations and prevents unnecessary user confusion.

name: Prudent Content Management
summary: When faced with non-actionable content, gracefully terminating the interaction while preserving provenance is a wise approach. This not only maintains data integrity but also fosters user trust.

name: Preservation of Provenance Metadata
summary: Preserving provenance metadata like session IDs, timestamps, and milestone logs is crucial for traceable wisdom extraction and validation of processes in generative models. Explicit documentation of architecture decisions and test coverage further enhances the reliability of insights derived from various workflows.

name: Active Inference Loop
summary: Active Inference embodies a principled loop characterized by three core functions: perception (updating beliefs based on observations), planning (evaluating actions with expected free energy), and acting (updating policies accordingly). This approach facilitates adaptive behavior in complex environments by leveraging learned priors.

name: Hierarchical Planning with Renormalising Generative Models
summary: Renormalising Generative Models allow for scale-free, hierarchical planning by effectively coarse-graining state representations across different levels. This abstraction aids in understanding and managing the dynamics of systems through core tensors that encode likelihoods, transitions, and path dynamics.

name: Memory Integration for Autobiographical Agents
summary: Integrating various types of memory—episodic, semantic, procedural, and strategic—is essential for autobiographical agents, as it informs decision-making and planning through learned experiences. This holistic approach cultivates a richer understanding of interactions within environments.

name: Embodied Enactive Design
summary: Embodied enactive design emphasizes the importance of understanding self/non-self boundaries and autopoiesis, enabling diverse interface attachments and robust adaptability in response to environmental changes. This principle fosters resilience in systems through active engagement and interaction.

name: Mature Workflow Practices
summary: Adopting mature workflow practices such as Test-Driven Development, feature branches, and continuous integration should be regarded as first-class components of system architecture. This facilitates more reliable and maintainable codebases, supporting agile development and iterative improvement.

name: Visualization and Narration for Validation
summary: Utilizing visualization and narration techniques provides interpretable traces of internal reasoning processes, thus enhancing validation and trust in decision-making. Techniques like cartpole_live and cartpole_narrated can effectively communicate complex interactions and thought processes.

name: System-First Orientation in Mental Models
summary: A system-first orientation within mental models advocates for an approach that emphasizes observation before action, iterative learning, and a focus on provenance-centric analytics. This mindset fosters deeper insights into system dynamics and enhances the efficacy of decision-making.

name: OODA Cycle in Exploration and Deployment
summary: Implement an OODA-like cycle in both exploration and deployment processes. Begin by observing the current state of the environment, orienting activities with planning and architecture, deciding on actions related to deployment or testing, and acting through data ingestion and testing.

name: Exploration Discipline
summary: Prioritize understanding the codebase and system status before executing any tasks. This foundational knowledge allows for informed decision-making and effective action.

name: Provenance Emphasis
summary: Ensure that metadata and session provenance are central to the exploration and deployment processes. This approach enhances accountability and traceability of actions.

name: Plan-Based Phased Deployment
summary: Adopt a phased deployment approach with distinct stages and milestones. This allows for structured progress monitoring and iterative improvement.

name: Spec-Driven Governance
summary: Leverage specifications and workflows (like SpecKit and associated checklists) to govern the development process. This provides clear guidelines and improves compliance.

name: Multi-Environment Deployment Pattern
summary: Differentiate between local development and VPS deployment, ensuring that networking and access controls are explicit and secure. This minimizes operational risks while deploying applications.

name: Incremental Knowledge Graph Construction
summary: Focus on building a knowledge graph in stages, involving ingestion, entity and relationship extraction, and maintaining provenance. This iterative process aids in data comprehension and utilization.

name: Memory Architecture Framing
summary: Adopt a five-layer memory architecture that incorporates an autobiographical layer. This self-awareness enhances decision-making and contextualizes actions within the broader framework of experience.

name: Provenance-Centric Workflow
summary: Implement a workflow that emphasizes the preservation of plan documents, commit history, and decision memory. This promotes transparency and fosters trust in the development process.

name: Batch Processing Approach
summary: Employ a batch processing approach to manage complexity in workflows, ensuring that tasks are organized into manageable batches to facilitate monitoring and execution. This can enhance clarity and efficiency when executing multiple tasks.

name: Risk/Mitigation Patterns
summary: Implement risk/mitigation strategies, such as revoking SSH access and managing environment variables, to enhance security and reliability. Regular health checks can proactively identify issues before they escalate.

name: Constraint-aware Problem Solving
summary: Engage in constraint-aware problem solving by operating within defined capabilities and read-only limits. This approach ensures that tasks are planned with available resources in mind, reducing the risk of failure.

name: Read-only Exploration
summary: Utilize non-destructive methods for code exploration, such as Glob, Grep, and Read tools, to analyze the codebase without altering its state. This method promotes safe examination and understanding of existing systems.

name: Explicit Capability Declaration
summary: Clearly state what can and cannot be accomplished in any given project or task. This transparency prevents scope creep and aligns expectations among stakeholders.

name: Modular Analysis
summary: Break down problems into components such as code search, file navigation, and pattern reporting. This modular approach allows for systematic investigation and efficient resource allocation.

name: Provenance-first Reporting
summary: Maintain the origin metadata for all findings to support comprehensive traceability and facilitate future audits or investigations. This practice increases the reliability of reports and decisions based on those findings.

name: Meta-learning from Logs
summary: Analyze logs and transcript data to infer patterns and discover opportunities for improvement. This practice enhances understanding of processes and informs better decision-making over time.

name: Dependency-aware Workflow
summary: Design workflows that explicitly check for essential services, implementing fallback paths when dependencies are unavailable. This approach mitigates risks associated with service unavailability.

name: Provenance-first Design
summary: Incorporate provenance metadata into all outputs to enable traceability throughout the wisdom extraction process. This promotes accountability and integrity in subsequent analyses.

name: Fault-tolerant orchestration
summary: Design systems that can gracefully degrade by recognizing and rerouting around optional or non-critical services when they become unavailable. This approach enhances resilience and maintains operational continuity even in adverse conditions.

name: Observability-driven decision making
summary: Utilize observable states, such as server connectivity and task discovery status, to guide decision-making and subsequent actions. This model emphasizes the importance of real-time feedback for timely and effective responses.

name: Modular task discovery
summary: Distinguish between task discovery and execution to facilitate flexibility in adapting to blockers. By separating these processes, organizations can better manage workflows and optimize task execution under varying conditions.

name: Session continuity by design
summary: Implement an attractor-based memory pipeline that reconstructs startup contexts at the beginning of each session. This ensures a seamless transition and continuity for users and systems.

name: Prefetched tasks pattern
summary: Employ a pattern that prefetches local Archon tasks and relays them to a VPS, effectively bridging network isolation while maintaining performance within latency bounds. This proactive approach mitigates potential disruptions due to network issues.

name: Episodic memory retrieval via Graphiti
summary: Prefer utilizing graph-backed memories for episodic retrieval when conventional Archon data is insufficient. This enhances data accessibility and relevance during memory recall.

name: Progressive disclosure
summary: Inject only compact, provenance-rich context into systems while retaining raw memories for future expansion. This allows for efficient information retrieval without overwhelming the processing capabilities.

name: Provenance preservation
summary: Ensure that source metadata—such as project IDs, task IDs, fragment types, and lineage—is maintained for traceability. This practice enhances accountability and facilitates effective tracking of information throughout its lifecycle.

name: Constraint-driven analysis
summary: Limit operations to read-only constraints and prioritize planning steps before execution. This method promotes thorough consideration of actions, thereby minimizing risks and enhancing decision quality.

name: Scope-first inquiry
summary: Begin with clarifying questions to define the scope of search and analysis. This approach helps focus efforts on relevant aspects and reduces wasted time on irrelevant data.

name: Observability and Provenance Governance
summary: Capture vital metadata such as session IDs and timestamps while preserving provenance to ensure reproducibility and maintain data integrity. This allows for careful audits of data flow and supports exploration without alteration of original files.

name: Search-First Information Gathering
summary: Utilize retrieval strategies to build comprehensive understanding before transitioning into coding or implementation stages. This approach allows for informed decisions and better designs informed by contextual knowledge.

name: Non-Destructive Exploration
summary: Engage in methodical exploration of logs and data without altering original files. This mindset fosters a culture of safety and accountability in development processes.

name: OODA-Oriented Communication
summary: Adopt a communication framework focused on observing credibility signals and orienting values to measurable outcomes. This results in carefully articulated decisions grounded in evidence and action plans that emphasize high-signal content.

name: Complexity Respect and Intellectual Integrity
summary: Acknowledge and articulate the complexity of concepts using precise language, while acknowledging trade-offs and tailoring communications for specific audiences. This practice builds trust and promotes understanding across diverse fields.

name: Emotional Work as Skill Building
summary: Frame sensitive emotional topics as skill development opportunities rather than therapeutic needs. This reframing acknowledges real challenges while inviting individuals to focus on mastery and performance enhancement.

name: Big-Picture Architecture First
summary: Prioritize understanding the overall system architecture and interdependencies of multiple files before engaging in code or implementation. This provides a holistic perspective and guides coherent development processes.

name: Empathy in Communication
summary: Recognize and validate the paradoxes and isolation experienced by stakeholders. Maintain an authentic tone that avoids patronization by emphasizing competence, return on investment (ROI), and expertise in communications.

name: DRY Principles and Provenance-Aware Reasoning
summary: Minimize redundancy in analysis and ensure that every insight is backed by clear provenance. This involves avoiding repeated information and recording sources, such as session IDs and URLs, for traceability.

name: Layered Architecture & Separation of Concerns
summary: Treat different components of the system (infrastructure, integration, frontend/backend) as distinct layers with defined interactions. This approach enhances clarity and maintainability.

name: Incremental / Guided Delivery
summary: Begin with high-level guidance before diving into details to prevent overwhelming stakeholders. This structured approach enhances comprehension and engagement.

name: OODA Loop in Workflow
summary: Employ a systematic observe-orient-decide-act loop in your workflow to stay adaptive. This involves continuously observing the work context and iterating on the outputs based on synthesized insights.

name: CTC Core Philosophy
summary: The conversion process is a transformative journey for the prospect. A conversion coach must guide belief shifts to foster readiness and responsiveness throughout the sales funnel.

name: SPIAD Framework
summary: Utilize the 'Sales Page In A Day' framework, consisting of 15 sections, to systematically lead prospects through transformative experiences while addressing gaps in understanding and engagement.

name: 3D Avatar of the Prospect
summary: Create a dynamic portrayal of the prospect by understanding them across demographics, psychographics, and ethos. This comprehensive view helps personalize messaging to enhance engagement.

name: MoHT & MoHP Framework
summary: Capture key moments of highest tension and highest pleasure in storytelling. These narratives engage prospects by addressing their biggest pain points and illustrating the benefits of resolution.

name: Sacred Cows in Belief Systems
summary: Identify and eliminate limiting beliefs that obstruct progress, replacing them with empowering narratives. This practice involves auditing communications for constraints and reframing challenges as opportunities.

name: The Starbucks Test
summary: Copy length should be matched to the complexity of the decision being made, ensuring that significant investments are accompanied by longer, more detailed content while quick decisions are supported by shorter materials. This model emphasizes the importance of pacing to optimize reader engagement and comprehension.

name: Enrollment Extractor & Launch Bible
summary: Utilize high-conversion conversations to distill effective messaging and compile these insights in a Launch Bible, which serves as a guiding document for crafting emails, landing pages, and sales pages. This process preserves the client's voice and essential insights before extensive writing begins.

name: Divergent Roads & Market's Search for Meaning
summary: This model presents two parallel realities at various time checkpoints—one with the product and one without—allowing for vivid decision-making moments that can reframe past failures as essential steps toward success. This approach serves as a risk mitigator and supports content that reinforces exclusivity and empowerment.

name: Migration-Driven Consolidation
summary: Focus on unifying legacy specifications into a single OpenSpec capability, clearly distinguishing between the WHAT and HOW to streamline future developments and migrations.

name: Governance-First Architecture
summary: Implement a governance-first approach to architecture that enforces the use of Graph Channel practices and continuous integration checks, restricting direct access to drivers to enhance security and maintain integrity.

name: Staged Validation Mindset
summary: Adopt a staged validation mindset during migration processes by utilizing tiered checks that focus on counting, content accuracy, and functionality to ensure each phase meets its objectives.

name: Provenance-Centric Engineering
summary: Incorporate provenance-centric engineering practices by preserving session metadata and source logs, enabling comprehensive lineage tracking throughout the system's lifecycle.

name: Hybrid Search Philosophy
summary: Adopt a hybrid search philosophy that integrates vector indexing, full-text search, and graph traversal techniques to enhance discovery capabilities across diverse datasets.

name: Provenance-Aware Design
summary: Ensure provenance-aware design by maintaining explicit metadata associated with processes and artifacts, facilitating auditable wisdom extraction for continuous improvement.

name: Performance-First Constraints
summary: Emphasize performance-first constraints by embedding latency targets early in the design and architecture decisions, guiding future development towards optimal performance outcomes.

name: Scoped Discovery and Iteration
summary: Begin with a scoped discovery phase to identify relevant files and patterns before engaging deeply with code or conversations. Utilize clarifying questions to define the scope clearly and reduce cognitive load, promoting iterative refinement throughout the process.

name: Provenance and Auditability
summary: Prioritize the capture of provenance metadata including session IDs, commit IDs, and timestamps to ensure traceability and reproducibility of decisions and actions. This approach enhances the integrity of the data and fosters a reliable audit trail.

name: Entity-Centric Evolution
summary: Migrate core ontological components such as Architecture and Episode to maintain the integrity of graph structures during evolution. This ensures that changes do not disrupt established relationships or data flows.

name: OODA Loop
summary: Embrace the OODA loop framework as a foundational pattern: Observe the current status, orient to system architecture and dependencies, decide on subsequent actions, and act through concrete commands and commits. This iterative process supports rapid adaptation and responsiveness.

name: Phase-Based Orchestration
summary: Organize work into clearly defined phases with explicit gates and milestones (e.g., Import, Sync, Archive, Documentation). This structured approach allows for risk-managed progression and enhances clarity within the development process.

name: Bidirectional Synchronization Principle
summary: Ensure a two-way linkage between systems like OpenSpec and Archon, using identifiers such as .archon-project-id. This practice preserves provenance and maintains consistent states across interconnected systems.

name: Non-Destructive Exploration
summary: Engage in a safe, non-destructive mode (read-only) to minimize risks when exploring systems or data. This approach fosters a secure environment for discovery and analysis without impacting the original configurations.

name: Theme Extraction
summary: Focus on extracting recurring themes across various interactions to create transferable patterns. This strategy emphasizes the importance of understanding broader insights over individual data points, enhancing decision-making and predictive capabilities.

name: Conflict Resolution Through Authority
summary: When conflicts arise between information sources, prioritize the authoritative source (Archon) for updates. Manual overrides can be applied as necessary to prevent regression in the face of conflicting information.

name: Automation-first Ethos
summary: Embrace an automation-first approach by utilizing tools like slash commands and scripts to streamline repetitive coordination tasks, reducing manual labor and minimizing human error.

name: Validation-driven Archiving
summary: Establish a robust archiving process conditioned on complete validation of data, ensuring that actionable remediation guidance and clear error messages are provided when states are incomplete.

name: Living Documentation
summary: Maintain documentation as a living artifact that evolves alongside the system, capturing current capabilities and usage patterns to keep user mental models in alignment with ongoing changes.

name: Startup Protocol for Readiness
summary: Implement a startup protocol that serves as a readiness gate by performing essential core checks before task initiation, such as confirming the activation of critical components and systems.

name: Task Discovery and Scope Alignment
summary: Early task discovery is critical; conduct OpenSpec checks and task discovery processes to define the scope clearly and align team expectations with project objectives.

name: OODA Loop Integration
summary: Utilize the Observe-Orient-Decide-Act (OODA) pattern: systematically observe the system state, orient based on capabilities, decide next steps through discovery, and act by initiating startup protocols.

name: Provenance Preservation
summary: In all outputs, explicitly preserve metadata such as session IDs, timestamps, and source references to ensure transparency and facilitate traceability.

name: Modularity and Scalability
summary: Promote a mental model favoring modular specifications, leveraging OpenSpec to support scalable capabilities that can adapt as requirements evolve.

name: Warmup as Risk Mitigation
summary: Incorporate warmup checks as a preflight measure to validate system readiness, thereby reducing the risk of downstream errors during operational execution.

name: Environment-First Mental Model
summary: Prioritize understanding the information ecology, including inputs, context, and constraints, before acting. This approach reduces misinterpretation and guides targeted analysis.

name: Provenance-Preserving Practice
summary: Capture source metadata and lineage for every insight to enable traceability and auditability. This ensures decisions are anchored in verifiable origins, promoting informed adaptation.

name: Iterative Refinement
summary: Initiate analysis with coarse summaries and progressively refine as more content becomes available or clarified. This process allows for increased clarity and accuracy over time.

name: Sparseness-Resilient Reasoning
summary: When faced with sparse data, clearly declare assumptions and avoid over-claiming. Focus on building insights from minimal viable signals to ensure robust conclusions.

name: OODA-Driven Operation
summary: Favor rapid Observe-Orient-Decide-Act cycles with explicit feedback loops to stabilize understanding in situations with limited content. This creates a dynamic approach to adapting insights in real-time.

name: Fidelity-First Funnel Replication
summary: Replicating a proven template with exact typography, colors, and structure in high-conversion workflows tends to preserve performance, avoiding regressions caused by superficial changes. Consistency in design is crucial.

name: OODA Loop: Observation → Decide → Act
summary: Regularly observe asset integrity and promptly decide to revert to or replicate proven assets when deviations arise. This method helps to ensure that design choices support conversion goals.

name: Provenance-anchored Adaptation
summary: All changes and decisions should be anchored to their origins, ensuring traceability and defensibility of design choices. This practice is vital for maintaining credibility in adaptations.

name: Mosaic-Mapping Readiness
summary: Capturing Senses, Actions, Emotions, Impulses, and Cognitions (S.A.E.I.C.) aids in revealing the tensions between aesthetic fidelity and functional constraints, such as asset URL issues. This understanding informs better design decisions.

name: Voice Consistency Principle
summary: Maintaining the established voice of the page is critical to sustaining audience trust and driving conversions across different sections. A consistent tone reinforces engagement and effectiveness.

name: Self-Contained Web Pages
summary: After fetching a page, convert all external references (CSS, JS, fonts, images) to local paths. This creates a self-contained page that loads reliably on any host while avoiding bloat and privacy concerns by stripping unnecessary scripts.

name: Stepwise Migration Process
summary: Break complex migrations into a predictable sequence, such as collecting assets, updating HTML, migrating CSS/JS, and testing. This method reduces errors and allows for reuse in future projects.

name: Responsive Design Refactor
summary: Convert absolute-positioned designs, like those in Unbounce, to responsive layouts using modern CSS techniques such as flexbox or grid. This ensures mobile friendliness and improved user experience.

name: Template-Driven Migration Kits
summary: Create a ready-to-use folder structure and templates for migrations to facilitate uniformity and efficiency. Examples include ghl_css.css and ghl_html.html, which streamline the migration process.

name: API and Tooling Automation Design
summary: When direct API access is limited, design automation processes with clear manual steps and scripts. Present options transparently to users to enhance usability and understanding.

name: Specification-Driven Design
summary: Treat formal specifications as the definitive source of truth to guide architectural decisions and reduce ambiguity in development processes.

name: Modular Pipeline Clarity
summary: Decompose cognitive processes into a deterministic and well-defined pipeline to enhance clarity, testability, and understanding of the workflow.

name: Single Source of Truth for Tech Stack
summary: Consolidate database strategies and architectural decisions to maintain a single narrative and prevent conflicting approaches in technology choices, ensuring clarity and consistency.

name: Stability by Default
summary: Freeze environments and dependencies to mitigate updates that can lead to system drift and flaky builds. This practice helps maintain a reliable development and production environment.

name: One-Truth Documentation
summary: Maintain a single, coherent narrative for architecture and deployment to prevent confusion. Ensure all documentation is aligned with reality, resolving contradictions and obsolete references that can mislead stakeholders.

name: Align Architecture with Specs
summary: Base architectural decisions on formal specifications and avoid ad-hoc changes that may violate these specifications. This helps in maintaining consistency and reliability in implementation.

name: Consolidate Tech Stack Choices
summary: Choose a single, documented approach for technology (e.g., Neo4j-only) to eliminate conflicting narratives. This consolidation facilitates clearer decision-making and reduces complexity in implementation.

name: Environment Stewardship
summary: Freeze and lock down dependencies and environments to minimize drift and stabilize builds. This proactive management reduces the likelihood of issues arising from inconsistencies in the technical environment.

name: Documentation Hygiene as Priority
summary: Regularly consolidate and audit documentation while addressing issues such as hardcoded paths and flaky references in tests. This promotes clarity and reliability in documentation across projects.

name: Triage-Driven Hygiene
summary: Categorize health checks into what’s good, broken, misaligned, and fake; use these categories to guide remediation efforts and improve overall system health.

name: Preserve Proven Implementations
summary: Archive clean and successful implementations to ensure recoverability and maintain knowledge persistence. This practice aids in future development by providing reference points and reducing onboarding time.

name: Risk Triage and Remediation
summary: Systematically categorize and address items identified as 'broken' and those that ‘pretend to work’ to effectively reduce risk exposure in the system. This strategic approach helps prioritize remediation efforts.

name: ARCHON-FIRST RULE
summary: Critical dependencies, such as Archon MCP, must be online for any task management workflow; operations should abort and require remediation if these dependencies are unavailable. This emphasizes the importance of dependency management.

name: Gated Workflow with Clear Blockers
summary: Structure workflows to ensure that progress is contingent upon essential systems, like OpenSpec and Archon connections. If critical services are unavailable, halt progress, report the blocker, and provide explicit remediation steps to restore capability.

name: Dependency Verification for Efficiency
summary: Before initiating any task, verify the availability of essential systems and tools to prevent wasted effort. This includes both prerequisite checks and tool capability discovery, ensuring actions are scoped appropriately based on what's accessible.

name: Deep Change Through Cognitive Architecture
summary: True transformation occurs when addressing the foundational cognitive structures rather than just surface habits. Techniques like emotional reconsolidation can catalyze lasting change by utilizing neural processes that rewrite entrenched behaviors and beliefs.

name: Mismatch Experience as a Catalyst for Learning
summary: Experiencing a gap between expectations and reality can trigger a neural window for updating beliefs, fostering cognitive flexibility. This allows the brain to adapt and rewrite patterns based on new information and experiences.

name: Safety and Belief Reformation
summary: Beliefs often persist because they provide a sense of safety; thus, reforming them necessitates re-signaling safety rather than solely relying on logical argumentation. Aligning changes with the brain's inherent safety needs is crucial for any lasting belief change.

name: Conscious vs Unconscious Processing Pace
summary: Conscious processing operates at approximately 40 bits per second, while unconscious processing is capable of handling around 40 million bits per second. For effective change, it's crucial to engage and harness the power of unconscious systems.

name: Three-Phase Change Protocol
summary: Implement a structured approach to transformation: Phase 1 involves reactivating and mapping existing schemas, Phase 2 focuses on generating prediction errors, and Phase 3 employs adaptive reconsolidation to rewrite cognitive patterns.

name: Target Foundational Architecture
summary: Design change initiatives aimed at altering core cognitive structures rather than merely addressing superficial symptoms or behaviors. This foundational focus promotes more sustainable transformation.

name: Create Mismatch Experiences
summary: Deliberately engineer scenarios that contradict old beliefs to create cognitive dissonance, thereby triggering an updating process during the reconsolidation phase. This approach facilitates deeper learning and adaptation.

name: Prioritize Non-conscious Interventions
summary: Implement interventions that engage unconscious neural processes rather than relying solely on willpower or surface-level tactics. Such strategies are more likely to induce lasting change.

name: Environment-first Verification
summary: Before taking action, always verify the current system status, active tasks, and relevant context. This ensures informed decision-making and effective task execution.

name: Option Framing for Scope Control
summary: Present a limited number of next steps to reduce decision paralysis and direct focus. This approach helps streamline action and enhances productivity.

name: Pre-action Scoping Ritual
summary: Conduct quick checks regarding status, active tasks, and location before commencing work. This ritual ensures that your efforts are relevant and aligned with current objectives.

name: Context-aware Scoping
summary: Differentiate between various content types, such as codebase and media/archive, to avoid misalignment in work and ensure targeted effort.

name: Communicate Health Upfront
summary: Provide a brief health check that outlines what is functioning well, what is not, and suggest potential next steps. This communication fosters transparency and encourages proactive problem-solving.

name: Free Energy Principle & Predictive Processing
summary: The system minimizes variational free energy (F = Accuracy + Complexity) through a five-layer information flow hierarchy. Precision weighting helps in guiding belief updates and learning rates, where bottom-up errors drive learning while top-down predictions refine processing.

name: Global Workspace as Consciousness Engine
summary: Consciousness emerges through winner-take-all competition among layers, with coalition formation allowing high activation and variance. This mechanism facilitates the integration of information across layers, essential for coherent cognition.

name: Modular Architecture for Generative Models
summary: Develop a modular and reusable architecture with clear component boundaries (e.g., ThoughtSeed, LayerState). This design ensures easy adaptation for renormalising generative model tasks while enabling serialization and persistence.

name: Adaptive Belief Updating
summary: Implement a BeliefStateManager to coordinate belief updates using adaptive per-layer learning rates and establish convergence metrics, ensuring robust performance in posterior updates.

name: Structured Validation and Metrics
summary: Utilize extensive testing and metrics for validation, including convergence and coherence checks. Incorporate CLI tools to ensure correctness and reproducibility of development efforts.

name: From Proving to Being
summary: Transform identity and motivation from seeking external validation through achievements to embodying an authentic state of being. Actions should align with inner transformation rather than mere performance indicators.

name: Pattern Recognition & Replacement
summary: Identify and consciously replace recurring cognitive patterns (replay loops) with intentional alternatives. Shift from merely diagnosing issues to actively driving proactive changes.

name: Obstacles-to-Solutions Framing
summary: Effectively structure problem-solving by first identifying obstacles and then presenting a single, structured solution complemented by a case study and measurable outcomes, fostering clarity and direction.

name: Media Directory vs. Code
summary: Recognize that the media archive contains primarily media assets with only specific code-related files (CLAUDE.md); it is vital to avoid misclassifying non-code assets as part of a software repository.

name: Recognition-Reframe-Permission-Direction
summary: This emotional-journey framework guides learners through challenges by first recognizing their struggle, then reframing it to view it positively, normalizing the experience, providing a clear action path, and offering affirmation to encourage progression.

name: From X to Y Transformation Language
summary: Employ explicit transformation phrasing (From X to Y) to vividly communicate progress and change, making the journey tangible and relatable for learners.

name: Time-Bounded, Concrete Practice Units
summary: Structured practice sessions with defined time limits (like 2/5/10 minutes) and clear, measurable deliverables enhance execution and maintain momentum in learning.

name: Three-Obstacle, One-Solution Pattern
summary: For every challenge presented, outline three distinct obstacles followed by a single structured solution. This approach should be reinforced with a relevant case study and specific actionable deliverables.

name: Direct Reader Address as Engagement Engine
summary: Utilize direct 'you' language to cultivate intimacy and accountability within the learning material, making it personally relevant and engaging for the learner.

name: Contrarian Framing Grounded in Neuroscience
summary: Challenge conventional wisdom by implementing neuroscience-informed reframing techniques that encourage deeper insights and reduce reliance on clichéd thinking.

name: End-of-Lesson Deliverables & Next Steps
summary: Conclude each lesson with clear deliverables and a seamless transition to the next steps, ensuring learners know what to expect and how to proceed.

name: Case-Study-Driven Learning
summary: Link learning concepts to specific, named case studies from the industry, anchoring theoretical ideas in a real-world context to enhance understanding and relevance.

name: Layered Metaphor Use for Cognition
summary: Integrate multiple, complementary metaphors (such as architecture, light, biology, growth) to build a scaffolding for comprehension and retention of complex ideas.

name: Capability Boundary Mapping
summary: Consistently align user requests with known capabilities, avoiding unrealistic promises regarding non-existent features. Direct users instead toward correct alternatives like MCP servers and slash commands.

name: Clarify-Then-Act Framework
summary: If an action is invalid or ambiguous, ask clarifying questions and pivot to feasible next steps rather than forcing the original request. This ensures effective communication and execution.

name: Prioritize with Explicit Task Order
summary: Triage work by explicit priorities, focusing on the top items first to manage workload and expectations. This helps in efficient resource allocation.

name: Clarity on Tool Capabilities Drives Efficiency
summary: Providing precise guidance about tool capabilities and configuration helps reduce friction and miscommunication, thus enhancing overall efficiency.

name: Modular Content Architecture
summary: Construct the manuscript as a modular system, utilizing front matter, phase blocks, and lessons for incremental assembly, validation, and replacement of placeholders without disrupting the entire structure.

name: Template vs Content Fidelity
summary: Differentiate between scaffolding and actual content; ensuring that placeholders are filled with real content is crucial for delivering a complete final product.

name: Progress Metrics for Validation
summary: Implement quantifiable checks such as word counts, phase weights, and content gaps to validate the completeness and balance of the manuscript.

name: Consistency Governance
summary: Maintain a consistent tone, character arcs, and structural format across sections, while flagging anomalies such as recurring character arcs and placeholder issues for review.

name: End-to-end Integrity Check
summary: Conduct a final validation to ensure all content is complete without gaps or unresolved placeholders, confirming that deliverables like the manuscript and assembly report are produced.

name: Balanced Phase Weighting
summary: Distribute content importance evenly across phases, aiming for a balanced total (e.g., 22-30% per phase) and adjust as necessary to maintain coherence.

name: Educate and Redirect on Architecture
summary: When faced with requests for non-existent features, educate users on the actual architecture (MCP, command files, settings path) and provide concrete next steps.

name: Memory Enhancement and Upgrade
summary: Memories and experiences are not merely erased but can be upgraded by adding context, modularity breaks, and agency, moving from a repetitive 'replay' into a richer representation.
